page.title: 13S.W. CROSS & SONS - FARM
page.content: The two Cross brothers farm 1660 acres (673 hectares) of land,which rises from a river valley into open country. The type of soil is mixed, varying from sandy boulder clay loam (25/30% clay) to sandy loam (5/10% clay). The subsoil is boulder clay, chalk and sand/gravel with peat in the river valley. 1500 acres(607 ha.) of arable crops & grass, 100 acres (42 ha.) of woodland,60 acres (24 ha.) of yards,ponds,roads etc. They employ 18 local men:10 arable workers, 4 for livestock, 2 for the workshop, 1 for building maintenance and 1 for transport. In 1985 the land was used as follows:- wheat 643 acres (260 ha.), sugarbeet 382 acres (155 ha.), barley 285 acres (115 ha.) and grass 190 acres (74 ha). There is a dairy herd of 160 Friesian and Friesian-cross as well as calves,yearling heifers,young and stock bulls. Animals can total 300 at times.
